data.title: Excellent backup dive computer
data.body:
As the second iteration of the Apple Watch Ultra, most of the capabilities in the watch are well-known at this point. It's chunky, but high-tech. If you're in the Apple ecosystem, it's an amazing way to get alerts, unlocks your Macbook since it stays authenticated as long as it's touching your skin and can be an auth token, and measure non-medical-grade health metrics. The battery life is great. Many days the battery only drops 10-20% for a full 12 hours use. I use it to ping my misplaced iPhone in the sofa cushions all the time.

The biggest reason for me getting the Ultra 2 vs. the non-Ultra Apple Watches is to use it as a SCUBA backup. computer. It's accurate on depth and temperature as compared to my Suunto Eon Steel. The screen is bright and easy to read. Things like haptic safety stops is a nice feature. I do hope they offer air integration in the future. I'm very happy with my Ultra 2. It's a daily wear item for me for casual dress and business casual. I wouldn't wear it with dresses and heels, but I don't have reasons to dress up much.

data.title: Great upgrade over my Apple Watch 6
data.body:
I have been eyeballing this watch since its Gen 1 release. I finally pulled the trigger when the rumors started that Apple might have to pull them off the shelf due to a patent infringement lawsuit. All of a sudden the prices dropped and I knew I had to buy it.

The jury is still out on the band. Don’t get me wrong, love the look and the fit. The problem is I run a lot, and the cloth band can get rather gross after several miles of running. So far I have been able to keep it pretty clean just by hand washing it, and several videos suggest you can throw it I the wash as long as you put it in a garment bag. Plus, worse case is I buy a different band, like one of the Nike rubber ones.

I love the battery life. Even with super heavy use I get a good 48ish hours between charges. Now I can use my watch to track my sleep at night. Charging is also pretty fast as long as you use a 5v charger. Typical charge time seems to be around 30min if I am at 25% battery.

The titanium case is also a marked improvement. Even though it’s much larger physically than my old Apple Watch 6 it feels way lighter. And I have banged mine around a bit at the gym and on the road and it still has no noticeable scratches at all in the case or glass.

data.title: Expensive but very fully featured and easy to read
data.body:
I've owned every apple watch model ever made and I'd say this one nails it in terms of general usability and battery life. Battery life on apple watches is still far from perfect (in comparison to analog or other digital watches) but the Ultra series at least makes it not a "charge it every day or it will be dead" proposition, and the brightness of the Ultra 2 is excellent.

It is also rugged and can climb and dive with you (I have not taken it particularly deep, but it's been good down to 30ft or so in free diving). Feels like a watch you can have adventures with.

data.title: Love the Ultra 2, awesome watch!
data.body:
I love the ultra 2. I had the series 1 but the screen popped off after 6 years of daily wear. I bought the series 7 when the series 8 came out knowing that I ultimately wanted the Ultra. I finally broke down and bought the Ultra 2 after reading rumors that the Ultra 3 probably wouldn’t come out until 2025. We’ll see.

The Ultra 2 is everything I hoped it would be. It’s an awesome watch. I’ll say it’s not much different than my series 7, but I think it’s worth it. Although I have an average size wrist, I’ve always preferred larger watches.

I’ll be keeping the series 7, as it is lighter and smaller, therefore more comfortable to sleep with. I’m hoping both of these will last me at least six years, like the series 1 did. Time will tell.

I’ve included pics of the Ultra 2 and Series 7 for size comparison.

data.title: Best smartwatch, bar none. Now bigger, brighter, and tougher.
data.body:
My first Apple watch, a Gen 5, was a surprise birthday gift from my family. It wasn't something I was thinking about, as I've been a fan of analog, solar-powered watches for years. And I didn't care for the way the early Apple watches went dark when you weren't looking at them, nor the need to charge a battery every day. But I loved that Apple watch (still do, my wife now wears it happily). I found it incredibly handy, especially after moving to work-from-home due to the pandemic -- picking up phone calls and keeping up with Outlook tasks is huge. AND, weirdly, the pesky "activity rings" encouraged me to get back into an exercise routine (just to shut them up) and I lost weight that had been bothering me for years. As a result, I've really gotten involved in the Apple health environment, linking my scale and tracking my various measurements. It's been a great motivator to keep improving my physical shape.

So, why the big, expensive Ultra? We do like to get outdoors (kayaking and nature photography here in Florida) so I've got a use for a durable, GPS-enabled device. And that Gen 5 was a little small for my maturing eyes. This watch handles all of that, and offers even more health data (Blood O2, etc.). And it hasn't disappointed.

Likes
Looks -- important in a watch. I'm not a huge guy, but all this "It's too BIG" hullabaloo is nonsense. It looks terrific on my wrist and is just as comfortable to wear as the smaller Gen 5 watch (thank you, titanium/ceramic construction).

Productivity -- It would be hard to go back to having to check my phone for calendar reminders, weather activity updates, etc. And even without a paid cell plan, the Ultra of course lets you answer calls on your wrist so long as your phone is nearby. It's a great help in a work-from-home environment.

So many complications!
The larger face on the Ultra 2 allows more complications, in a more readable fashion, and the Ultra-specific watch faces show them off to great effect. I don't know if I need to know my altitude, compass heading, number of steps, outside temp, day, date, time, battery status, and upcoming Outlook tasks all at once, but I really enjoy having that ability now.

Outdoors
I've used the Ultra for exercise tracking (works great, of course) and it's had no trouble banging around the yard, but so far no nautical outings or hikes to test the backtrack or other GPS features to track distance (and keep you from getting lost!). But I'm sure glad to have them.

Battery
I mean, more would be better, but my Gen 5 was running out of juice after about 15 hours, and the Ultra 2 is generally in the 70-80% range after the same period. I still charge it every night, but I don't worry about it giving up before then as I was starting to have to do.

Not So Likes
None really so far. Okay, paying iPhone money for a watch is a lot. But to be fair, it's not hard to spend what the Ultra 2 costs on either a fancy outdoors watch like a Fenix/Garmin, or a more traditional high-tech watch like a Citizen, or a really nice looking watch from whomever.

To me, this one covers it all. Attractive titanium case, Sapphire crystal, water resistant enough for diving; tough enough to take out boating or hiking, all in a multi-billion-transistor wrist computer with dozens of customizable watch faces, a compass, altimeter, depth gauge, heart monitor, blood oxygen sensor, sleep and exercise tracker, appointment reminder, music player and wrist telephone. Phew.

And yes, it tells time, more accurately than a $200,000 Rolex that can't access the Internet. And it doesn't need to be reset twice a year for Daylight Savings Time.

I wish the Apple bands were more plentiful and less expensive. I got the comfy Trail Loop, but it would be nice to have the Ocean too without paying another $99. But I've been wearing my existing silicone sport bands most of the time (large Gen 5-up bands fit perfectly) and Amazon has a staggering number of Ultra-compatible watch bands available (picked up a really nice SS mesh band for business outings for $27 and a leather one for about the same).

Bottom line
If you have an iPhone, an Apple smartwatch is a no-brainer. Yes, it's another thing to charge at night, but you're already doing that. And it is almost odd how handy it is having so much information available on your wrist -- once you have it, you won't want to be without it. I also think the exercise integrations are huge, whether you're a hardcore gym rat, or just need to make sure you didn't sit in a chair all day -- being able to track your improvements is a great motivator. It's been a game changer for me. I literally exercise in part to watch my "numbers" improve. Weird, but true.

As for the Ultra -- the name's a bit much, and the price is steep, but if you want MORE of what Apple smart watches can do, in a bigger, more attractive, sturdier, more capable package, this is a great piece of gear. I couldn't be more pleased.

Five big, smart stars.

data.title: Great watch with awesome battery life
data.body:
I really love the action button and the flat screen. My favorite band is the trail loop. The battery life is great, I only have to charge it once every 2 - 3 days. Phone calls sound clear and the other person can hear me clearly.

I’m not too worried about damaging this watch. It’s durable and I have added Apple Care+ for additional protection.

data.title: Beautiful Apple watch
data.body: It was one of the most amazing and beautiful Apple Watches I have ever owned. The orange ocean band makes my watch stand out in the crowd. When I travel, I don’t need to worry about frequent charging during extended flights. The excellent waterproof feature takes away my worry when I wash my hands. Love all the built in health features to keep me fit and safe!

data.title: Better than I thought
data.body:
Getting about 72 hours of battery life to pleasantly surprised. Nice to have health info schedule and weather all on one screen. Two little issues

1) when I say hey siri I never know whether the watch or phone will respond. Even when I hold the watch to my face sometimes the watch will stay quiet and the phone will respond from my pocket - but then can’t hear the rest of what I said
2) the little finger click gesture - they have some major bugs to work out on that. Works about 10% of the time for me

Otherwise works great. Very customizable. Nearly infinite watch faces available. Expensive but if you have a busy life and or health issues and want to track steps activity heart rhythm heart rate O2 and get alerts from various sources on your wrist that is all worth it IMHO.

Only real negative is the included magnetic charger stopped working within a week. So buy a backup. A pittance in cost compared to the watch but irritating

data.title: Really good watch, but price???
data.body: I didn’t purchase this watch with my own money but I was lucky enough Chase reward points, but this is an EXPENSIVE watch. I used to own an Apple Watch Series 3 and was looking for an upgrade. I was either going to get a series 9 or the new Ultra 2. I ended up splurging on the ultra 2 and honestly it’s an extremely good watch. I’m personally a very clumsy person and my Series 3 looked like it has been through a war or two however, the titanium makes this watch super durable and almost resistant to dinks and scratches. Another thing the battery life! One of the best features of this watch, I usually charge the batter every 1.5 days and if I’m lucky sometimes even 2 days. The heart rate tracking pings a lot more so you’re able to get much more accurate tracking and this is great if you’re into fitness. I’m not really a diver, marathon runner, etc, but this watch for day to day use is definitely over kill. If you’re considering this watch I would just recommend you figure out your priorities on why you want it. I also love being able to use this for sleep tracking every night without needing a charge beforehand. Overall if you have the money I would say get it, but if you’re looking for a better price Series 9 or even older is the way to go.

data.title: Awesome battery life
data.body:
After a month of owning this apple watch, I can say that the improvements are crazy! I have had a series 5 for the past 4 years and decided to upgrade after it no longer lasted through the day (and I recently got SCUBA certified and needed a dive computer). This watch has been outstanding. The dive system with Oceanic+ is great (I don't dive too frequently so paying $10 per trip is worth it).

Additionally, the battery life on this is off the charts. I consistently get 48-72 hours off a single charge, without even being in low power mode. I love being able to track my sleep with this because of the extended battery.

data.title: I love it
data.body: I love my new watch. Like a few people have said, it is a little on the heavy side, but not so much so that it’s uncomfortable to wear or even noticeable, honestly. At least not after you’ve put it on and wearing it, you don’t even realize the weight after about 5 minutes of wearing it. So, if you’re hesitant in making this purchase based on it being heavy, don’t let that stop you from enjoying this watch. It’s not at all that bothersome. They features are all great. The “fall detection “ can be a tad bit annoying any time you bonk your hand on something, or smack the newspaper down on a hard surface to gain your dog’s attention lol you’ve gotta stop what you’re doing and tell it you’re okay and to not call rescue lol. Other than that, I couldn’t be happier with it!! Highly recommend

data.title: Exactly What I Expected
data.body:
I'm an older guy but still exercise, hike, walk, etc. I've had knee replacements on both knees with the last one being just a few weeks ago. I've had several Garmin's, my last a Venu 2. I had problems keeping them synced to my iPhones but loved the long battery life. I wanted something with fall detection, the ECG feature and would play nice with my iPhone 14. I've not been disappointed. It is so easy to use compared to my Garmin. Battery life is not nearly as good but charging it about every 3rd day has not bothered me at all.

I did have a chance to test the fall detection. The night after my surgery while in the hospital I got up and due to a nerve block my leg gave way and I went to the floor. My Ultra 2 immediately said fall detected and was I okay. Fortunately I was. I hope it never happens again but if it does I know it works.

data.title: Best so far
data.body: I mostly bought it for the fall detection as I am getting older it's nice to have the security in case I fall also the flashlight is nice the longer battery is much better than even the series 9 which I own as well

data.title: Watch is great
data.body: The rubber band is not something I liked. It never fit right and left indentations on my wrist. I replaced it with a titanium band which looks better and fits perfectly (after adjusting). The new watch features are super especially the dive mode

data.title: He loves his new Apple Scuba Diving Watch
data.body:
So, I decided to take my Apple Watch Ultra 2 on a deep-sea adventure, and let me tell you, it's not just a smartwatch; it's a certified scuba buddy! As I descended into the abyss, I half-expected it to transform into a mini submarine – alas, it didn't, but it did keep track of my dive time like a champ.

The underwater experience was so immersive that I almost asked Siri for the best seafood restaurants in the area. I mean, if you're going to dive deep, might as well plan a fantastic post-dive meal, right?

The water-resistant feature worked like a charm, and my watch emerged from the depths drier than a desert. I almost felt sorry for it, wondering if it missed the thrill of a good splash. Perhaps Apple should consider adding a "water play" mode to satisfy its aquatic cravings.

Now, if only it had a fish translation app – imagine having a chat with a curious clownfish about the latest updates in the tech world. "Have you heard about the new iPhone Fishbowl Edition?" I'd ask. Who knows, they might be tech enthusiasts too.

In conclusion, the Apple Watch Ultra 2 isn't just a timekeeper; it's a fearless underwater companion, a potential gourmet guide, and possibly a future diplomat in the fish community. Dive on, my friends, and may your underwater adventures be as entertaining as Siri's attempts to decipher dolphin clicks!

data.title: Huge upgrade for battery life
data.body: Kinda always hated having to charge every day to not even make it through the day. This watch changes that ! I charge for maybe a hour or less one time a day and if I forget its works for the next day as well.

data.title: It’s expensive!
data.body: I bought the ultra 2 to replace my series 5 which shattered when I dropped it. I’m hoping it is a lot tougher than a series 9 which is about half the price and has all the features I need. I have had one problem with the watch going crazy switching between apps and entering passcodes on its own and not being able to stop it. It did this for about 20 minutes but stopped when I put the watch on the charger. The ultra 2 is a large watch and will stick up on your wrist making it easy to bump on things.

data.title: Nice
data.body: this is the best watch Apple has made so far, very durable and feels great on the arm, a little expensive, but worth it, I have an apple watch series 7 45mm and a series 9 45mm, those are both great watches, but I wanted something bigger and I love this one.

data.title: Great product but not for everyone.
data.body: I love this as a smart watch just like any other apple watch, but its more than that. This one was especially good for me for its dive computer feature, which came in quite useful in Mexico a few months ago. That part worked great at 30m and I couldn't recommend it more!

data.title: Just order this and still has the Oxygen App!
data.body: All good new, wanted to order this in Amazon as if I buy in Apple wont get a Oxygen App.

data.title: My first
data.body: This is my first Apple Watch and my father and grandfather both had heart attacks. My grandfather died young due to a heart attack. Figuring that genetics is playing games with us I thought this would help even out the odds. So far it tells me the time and reminds me that the wife is the boss so in her eyes it is the best gift she has ever given me. Essentially it keeps me alive so she can kick my a$$ longer! Yay! So much fun.

data.title: Great purchase
data.body: Didn’t really want to pay the extra for the more durable and longer battery life but so glad I did. This watch has not disappointed. Received item on time

data.title: Love this watch
data.body: I needed the watch for the ECG feature. I love this watch. Setting up phone plan is a real game changer for my long runs. Battery life could be better.

data.title: The description they give you is most accurate
data.body: It was new in the box, but the box has been open. I had no problem except for setting it up, I finally got it. You can trust Amazon. You really get a great deal.

data.title: Love My Apple Watch!
data.body: I LOVE my Apple products!

data.title: I bought one from Apple directly, when I went back to order one for my husband they were sold out.
data.body: I bought one from Apple directly, when I went back to order one for my husband they were sold out. So Amazon to the rescue. We love the large display face and the capabilities to make phone calls - just all around happy with the purchase.

data.title: I am delighted with the quality of the used materials.
data.body: I am delighted with the quality of the used materials. Top-notch, glad for my choice.

data.title: Its large.
data.body: Use it for long walks. The volume on calls is higher than my old version 4 watch. Learning what else I can use it for. Like the nightstand function.

data.title: Good watch despite battery and vendor lock-in
data.body: The watch has been great for tracking activity ( steps, brisk walks, and standing) as well as a convenient way to respond to notifications from apps quickly. The vendor requirement to own a phone from them to get features in the phone is disappointing and the battery needs charged more often than I'd like. Overall a nice item.

data.title: Durable & Accurate
data.body: This was my first apple watch and I really like it. It seems very intuitive.

data.title: Love the Apple Watch Ultra 2
data.body: There is only one word to describe this watch - "GREAT"!

data.title: POOR AMAZON SERVICE
data.body: Great watch with new features. My only criticism is to warn you do not buy Apple products from Amazon. I returned this watch UNOPENED to Amazon and 5 weeks later have yet to receive a refund. Even tho my orders page indicates item returned and I am due a refund. Already in dispute with AMEX.

data.title: Beautiful piece of tech
data.body:
I bought it 2 weeks ago. I thought it would be hideous but useful. I was completely wrong. I’m an outdoors kind of guy and it works wonderfully when I run cycle snorkel in the sea, swim laps in the pool and more.

The bands and watch faces can be changed to make it work for smarter occasions. I bought a third party titanium band and put a smart watch face on the screen and now it looks nice and spiff.

I highly recommend this product!

data.title: Great gift
data.body: Gave it as a Christmas gift and it was a hit. My husband keeps finding more special features we didn’t know it had. Great quality Apple product!

data.title: Ultra Means Ultra
data.body: This purchase was a gift to myself with an Amazon gift card for 40 years of service at my company. I love the look and functionality of this Apple Watch and the quality really is ultra. I appreciate the larger screen real estate on the Ultra because you can see it better and can add more complications to the bigger screen. I’m very happy with this purchase.

data.title: It came on time
data.body: This watch is working good

data.title: Best watch ever for biometrics
data.body: I bought two different loops over the past three years thinking they were top-of-the-line for sleeping analysis and other biometrics. I’m a position and I came to the conclusion they’re completely junk. I once woke up sick as a dog and told me I had a 94% recovery, so that was my last straw. So I finally broke down and bought an Apple Watch and this thing just continues to amaze me. The problem with Whoop is it’s all about last night and not much about right now where the ultra 2 is all about everything.

data.title: Apple Ultra2
data.body: Watch does it all

data.title: This is an incredible watch
data.body: After about 9 months of evaluating which smart watch I wanted, the final decision was the Apple Watch Ultra 2. The competition was the Garmin 75 Pro, a very fine watch but it's a hardcore sports watch. I am not that level of athlete, so I chose the Ultra 2. I love the watch because of its many functions including phone service that does not require your iPhone to make and receive calls. It's the real Dick Tracey phone from my childhood. It's interface with the iPhone is the main reason in my selection and I was not disappointed. I am very happy with my purchase. For apps there is a choice between icons and list. The icons fill about 3 screens which you can control using touch screen or you can use a list mode for more description. You can instantly toggle between the two. The screen is large, but the watch is lightweight, and is very comfortable to wear. Charging has not been an issue, it's fast and easy.

data.title: as advertised *****
data.body: as advertised *****

data.title: The watch is better than I thought
data.body: Expensive but I really like this watch, otherwise works great and very customizable, has all the necessary vital functions. It has a large number of programmable different watch faces, quick and easy strap changes.. I love the watch!

data.title: Very useful
data.body: I use this for personal use for exercising in the gym and cycling on my mountain bike and keeping track on my weight. I am still learning more future for this device and I’m extremely happy with my purchase.

data.title: Great Apple Watch
data.body: The battery life is outstanding you can get more than two days without charging

data.title: Love my new watch and the increased battery life
data.body: I had an older iwatch but got tired of having to charge sometime up to twice a day. The new ultra last 30 hours, recharges reasonably fast and it’s slightly larger and very much brighter display makes it easier to read.

data.title: So many features for a smartwatch 😊
data.body: There are so many features I love with this watch, but the flashlight on the watch is awesome to use at night 👀

data.title: Cheap band
data.body: It’s an Apple Watch. You know what you are getting. The band it came with feels really cheap. But I took a nice metal band from my previous watch which was a direct fit.

data.title: It's an Apple Watch Ultra 2!!
data.body:
What more can I say that hasn't been said! This is an Apple Watch Ultra 2! It has great features and battery life etc (right when my current Apple Watch 6 seems to be having battery issue).

I picked this up on a discount making it really good value!

data.title: Insane battery life - not worth it over Ultra 1
data.body: If you can get Ultra 1 at a decent price, just go buy that one. If you have Ultra 1, don't upgrade. If this is your first Ultra, then yes! I bought this for my dad, he loves it. Battery life is insane (2-3 days) and it's rugged so he won't break it. Highly recommend it especially if you can find it on a discount.

data.title: I love this watch a lot more than I thought I would
data.body: Battery life lasts well over a day for my use. The watch is beautiful, not heavy at all (compared to my series 6 stainless steel watch), and performs as expected from an Apple product.

data.title: Love this watch
data.body: I needed this upgrade because the microphone in the other versions went out over time - probably because I wear it in the shower. So far, so good.

data.title: I got it for cheaper than Apple Store.
data.body: I thought the watch would look gigantic on my thin wrist, but I’ve learned to like it. The screen is scratch resistant. The shell isn’t and mine is scuffed up a lot since I wear mine at work.

data.title: Great watch
data.body: Better battery and functionality

data.title: Amazing Watch
data.body: I really like this watch - so much better than my previous Apple Watch (Series 5). There were three features that convinced me to buy this watch: 1) brightness, 2) battery life 3) Oxygen Sensor. As you all probably know by now, it looks like Apple is going to remove the Oxygen Sensor - not happy about that. This is why I am only giving two stars for the "Value for Money" - I hope that Apple provides us some compensation for the loss of this feature. Only time will tell....

data.title: Consider before buying
data.body: Very nice watch. I honestly have no overall complaints. The basic apps (or complications) seem to work fine. A few new ones are quite nice. For me, there are a few apps I could really use on the watch but require them to be opened on my phone to work. This kinda defeats the purpose of having them on your watch. For the price I expected a bit more but its durability makes it a great watch for the outdoors - providing you keep your phone handy.

data.title: Great festures
data.body: Larger size easier to read and the great EKG and weather monitor are accurate . Exercise and GPS work well.

data.title: Battery life improved
data.body: I’ve had an Apple Watch Series 2 and a Series 6. My complaint with them is the battery life. Apple Ultra 2 Series has a much better battery life so not constantly having to put it on the charger.

data.title: The best smart watch and activity tracker, in my opinion
data.body: Love it !

data.title: The best yet....
data.body: I get 3 and a half days of battery life with this monster! Really cool and I put a big GShock looking band on it and everyone notices. The always on screen is the 5h1t and is clear and bright. It does do the blood oxygen stuff as well and I am very impressed..... This is very dumb not to upgrade to if you have the resources.

data.title: I love the watch!
data.body:
I upgraded from Aw gen 2. This Ultra 2 is awesome! Same features as older watches just must smoother! Watch face is 49mm so it is a lot easier to scroll and use the apps. Apps run great.

Watch band is nice, but I need to get a new one due to offsets sweat from exercise. I plan to spend the money for an Apple band. Yes the bands are $99, which is very high for a band, I wouldn’t want to put a band on the watch that doesn’t match the quality.

Overall, Go for it! Buy the watch! Enjoy 😎

data.title: Great watch
data.body: Daily Use

data.title: Great investment
data.body: Enjoying it and I love that it’s a bigger screen

data.title: Form and function from Apple
data.body: I am 72. My version of extreme sports is walking my dog 3x daily. I bought this watch because I like the titanium/sapphire look and because some of the functions I find useful. I like the ECG capability. I suspect the last thing I will see before I die will be my watch face. I check the weather frequently and it’s great for messages and phone calls. Still can’t believe I can make phone calls using my watch without my phone present. The dynamic wallpaper is beautiful. Overall, a real achievement in technology and design for a lot less than a Rolex.

data.title: Best Apple Watch
data.body: Long battery life and easy to see the screen.

data.title: Worth it
data.body: Love this watch. I upgraded from the Apple Watch and noticed the difference. Battery life is excellent...can go a full 2 days before needing to charge. The charger that came with it is rugged and charges the watch within an hour or so.

data.title: Apple is number one again!
data.body: This is by far the best Apple Watch to date. Battery, screen, Siri, Titanium, and reaches a long way. Then you always can make it a phone line if you want. LOVE IT!!

data.title: Amazing Apple
data.body: Bought this watch for my husband. He’d been wanting it for a while! It is perfect for a man as its size is a bit in the larger side. He was very happy with it. As of now I don’t know to much about any of the added features like the dive stuff. He was hit by a car and really hasn’t been able to enjoy it just yet.

data.title: Some many features
data.body: My 1st Apple Watch and I love it

data.title: Beyond words
data.body: I really like this product.. It's my primary hand piece…. There isn't anything to dislike..

data.title: Best Purchase EVER!
data.body: This product came well packaged and looked exactly as if I just bought it at the Apple Store! I was a little hesitant to buy it through Amazon but I have no regrets after receiving it. I Love THIS WATCH! Best Watch Apple has ever made hands down!

data.title: Sturdy and easy to read than my prior apple watch
data.body: Battery performance is excellent!

data.title: Love this bigger watch.
data.body: Always used Apple Watch since 2018. Last Apple Watch I had for three years thought to upgrade to this one. It was well worth Upgrade love the huge display. The biggest thing is the battery life I can easily get two days out of it. Where is the my iPhone need charges at least the 15 Pro Max at least two times a day.

data.title: Great gift for my guy!
data.body: He loved it— the blue band is super nice and the watch has all of the cool features a guy needs to do guy stuff….. like scuba dive and work out! He loved it.

data.title: So easy to use
data.body:
I really like the largeness of this watch since I have asked you arthritis and things are hard to use when they’re very small as my fingers don’t work so very well anymore.
I like the way the door walk application works go sometimes I get home and forget to stop the walk and end up with a long long walk I didn’t take being recorded. I wish there was someway that it would notify stopped and put it on pause and dinged for me so I realize that I had finished and needed to stop it perhaps someday that will be worked out for people like me.

data.title: Amazing
data.body: I bought the silver stainless steel series 9, and it just didn’t quite seem like a worthy upgrade. This one is truly an amazing upgrade from any series of Apple Watch.

data.title: What is not to love.
data.body: You get what you pay for and this is everything with a little extra.

data.title: Best Apple Watch to date
data.body: I’ve had at least three different series of Apple Watches and this by far is the biggest screen and also the longest battery life I’ve ever had. The features so far match the series 9 with a few extra.

data.title: Awesome
data.body: I got this for my husband as a surprise Christmas present and he was so happy. It was nice not to have to go to the Apple Store.

data.title: So light
data.body: Works great , and with the titanium, you don’t know youre wearing it

data.title: Superworks
data.body: So the extra mm make a diff on this scale. It’s just super useful. I charge it every 2 1/2 or so days. Super responsive super bright when you need also super dim when you want. Yah it costs money but if you want a smartwatch that is reliable and nice this is it.

data.title: Yeah go big
data.body: Worth it all day to get the extra real estate.

data.title: Works great
data.body: As advertised

data.title: Another year, another device. (Sigh)
data.body:
Technology each year keeps getting an update that create the fear of missing out. The first ultra released around the time I got the seven and sometimes patience is a virtue. Didn’t think much about it until this year saw the Ultra Two and thought why not. The difference in size does make my first watch seem really tiny, looking out of place on my wrist. All that to the side what is the upgrade? Almost not noticeable since whatever is included wouldn’t be useful to anyone rocking one to average locations. The only key features are that you got an increase size to the watch with supposedly a brighter screen (Haven’t notice, could be privacy screen) now you’re wondering if it’s actually worth it.

It’s probably just preference in the end cause the other essential feature is having a better battery, not having to worry about it dying at work if forgetting to charge. Any owner of ultra probably already is happy with their previous purchase and the lack of color choice is a good reason to wait another year to see if they come out with a better one.

data.title: You need a young person to set it up and it will take a while to understand all the features.
data.body: Gift for my husband.

data.title: Good watch, just too big for my wrist
data.body: I really liked the watch and features, it was just too large for my liking. I had a series 3 and this was a large size jump. I returned for the series 9

data.title: Great
data.body: This watch is so much better than my previous older version but it is bulky and sporty-looking

data.title: Not my style
data.body:
This thing is fugly. And huge. To top it off, none of the hardware and software features were of interest to me. Having to download a separate app to do serious gps work was a letdown.
I didn’t feel like it was worth the price. Back it went.
Oh yeah. I learned Amazon has a new return protocol where high ticket items like this get sent back to a return center via mule train. It took over two weeks to travel from N California to Las Vegas. I thought it was legit lost in transit.

data.title: love this apple watch
data.body:
it’s got a brilliant battery life which is most important to me to keep track of my workouts and classes i do several times a day as a trainer the watch face is a good size and i love the strap strong and sturdy
this apple watch is absolutely worth it

data.title: Many useful features.
data.body: Just upgraded from a Series 8 Apple iWatch. As a hiker, it is important to have a means to make contact if there is a serious problem on the trail. With the very accurate GPS and Emergency 'call' feature, one can feel more secure (especially when hiking alone). The Blood Level Oxygen and Heartrate features are also useful. So many more features that you wonder how all this can be 'packed' into such a small device.

data.title: Best Smartwatch I ever had
data.body:
This Apple Watch Ultra 2 is simply awesome. I upgraded from a Series 7 (my first) and this one has so many new features, it is faster and much more responsive.

I love the bigger screen, which makes scrolling so much easier, and the action button is great for customizing recurring actions, like starting a timer (my preference).

Th only thing a little awkward are the placement of the crawn and home button (I think its the same problem for the first Ultra) as every time I flick my wrist strongly (like pushing down on something) it takes a screenshot. Not a big deal, but something definitely worth fixing by apple in a redesign.

But overall. this is the best smartwatch I had so far and I am wearing it every day now.

data.title: Best Amazon service
data.body:
The watch is what you can expect from a great Apple product.
Best was Amazon service today. We missed the delivery as we weren't at home. One quick chat and a couple of minutes the super nice driver was back at our door and we are safe for Christmas!!! Awesome service Amazon. Thank you.

data.title: Good price and timely delivery
data.body: Xxoo

data.title: Badass
data.body: This is my 5th Apple Watch and it is the best model I’ve had, and second place isn't even close. Battery life, screen size and brightness are dramatically improved from the series 7. Only critique is the band. It’s well made and the purpose of the design is obvious, but I find the magnetic leather band or the mesh Velcro band to be more comfortable.

data.title: Good product
data.body: This is a good product recommended

data.title: Comfortable
data.body: Surprised how comfortable it was to wear and easy to set up. Definitely can recommend this watch.
